name: Hotel Botanico & The Oriental Spa Garden

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first trip to Tenerife and the Hotel Botanico, but we are keen to return. (Especially after getting back to England to be greeted by rain and 6 degree C temperatures...in May.) Overall, an excellent experience. Between the two of us, we have traveled most of the world and stayed in a lot of places (work and fun trips). The Hotel Botanico was at the very top for consistent top-level friendly service by the team. That, and the amazing hotel grounds, make this place exceptional. Summary by area:
reviews.title: Excellent experience at Hotel Botanico

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ++Reception/Concierge: All helpful, but Vanesa deserves special note for being so genuinely cheerful and helpful. The lead concierge (sorry, her name escapes me at the moment) was also especially helpful, researching Mt. Tiede summit permissions, booking cave tours, etc..
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ++Food and beverage:
reviews.title: Service and style

reviews.text: Breakfasts were good, lots of variety on offer and all food fresh. The fruit and fresh juices were really appreciated. Sometimes the egg/omelette station gets a backlog, but on the last day a second team member came over and helped do fried eggs. This plan should be kept in place, especially going into busier times. Only other minor issue was that at least half of the days, the tea water which I was given was not hot enough to make tea. It would be better to fill the jugs with boiling water at the time of serving, not in advance.
reviews.title: Even better than before .......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dinner: We only had one dinner in the hotel, in the Oriental restaurant. Food was lovely, with an excellent sauce on the duck curry.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: Wonderful hotel. Clean and very well presented. Food excellent as is the spa and there is free pool (as in on a table), tennis, table tennis and an excellent (large) putting green with driving net and practise bunker. The staff couldn't have been nicer (For example a concierge tracked my son and I down to the putting green to tell us that he'd checked and 'the game is indeed on in the library/ TV room at 8' having tried to ring our room. This meaning that the lovely receptionist who saw us ask him must have remembered our names. Impressive as we only stayed 2 nights).
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel - but some guests less wonderful

reviews.text: The only negative issue was that most other guests (when we stayed at least) were elderly and not necessarilly very friendly!
reviews.title: quality,comfort and excellent service
At last a 5 Star Hotel worth the rating
reviews.text: Be assured that this hotel is a first class luxury product. It delivers high standards in comfort, food and service in a truly relaxed environment. The location is ideal for someone that wants to have everything at hand if required and is also far from the madding crowd .I can safely say without a shadow of a doubt that this is by far the best hotel I have ever stayed at, in any Spanish resort or major city.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in an ambassador suite which was spacious, nicely furnished a good TV with all the comforts of home. It had a nice sea view. However, although the bathroom is big the shower itself was not great. I enjoyed the restaurants most especially the La Parilla were the service and cuisine were excellent. This brings me to the half board option offered. It is exceptional value for money allowing you the choice of any items on the A La Carte menu at all 3 restaurants. It is not buffet style and the option of what would be considered fine dining each night was a real plus.. Breakfast was good but often like all buffets sometimes very full and a little chaotic.
reviews.title: Absolute bliss!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I enjoyed the Spa and the cost of treatments were fair and realistic. This adult only section was a special oasis with high end facility's and products, The main pool was enjoyable with a good service. Sadly part of my time there was often marred by a most unruly extended family that showed little consideration for other pool users. Allowing some guests and their children to behave in a manner not acceptable in most other public spaces, does sometime require a management intervention to ensure the well being of other guests.
reviews.title: A wonderful hotel

reviews.text: A little bit tired and definitely seen better days - anyway that's enough about me!
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is great but yes, it is a little bit tired. It was really relaxing though. The staff were incredibly charming and attentive. The prices in the bar were fairly reasonable but I cannot vouch for the restaurants as I eat in the town every night. The pool was lovely- no problem getting a lounger any time during the 6 nights I was there.
reviews.title: Great staff and fabulous spa

reviews.text: Really enjoyed my stay here and if you are a keen walker, the Tiede National Park is wonderful.
reviews.title: Fantastic Service

reviews.text: Buy a decent walks book before you leave UK though.
reviews.title: Great for a relaxing break..

reviews.text: We spent a most enjoyable week here in mid April. The reception and front-of-house staff were extremely welcoming and helpful. We had a room on the 3rd floor with a pleasant although admittedly distant sea view, however, we preferred this to overlooking the pool or Mount Teide. We got the sun on our balcony in the late afternoon/early evening which was great. It was very peaceful and quiet. The housekeeping staff were efficient and friendly. The hotel is very well run and the grounds are immaculate. The Oriental Spa area is simply superb and a great place to relax. We walked downhill into Puerto de la Cruz several times - takes about 20 minutes - but took the lazy option of a taxi back for under 5 euros!
reviews.title: The way things should be.

reviews.text: A lovely, clean and relaxing hotel. Good food (though breakfast processes could be improved) at reasonable prices. It seems to have v good service for a Spanish hotel with well trained and eager staff. A beautiful spa area is a welcome respite from the families around the main pool. Both are clean and well maintained. Rooms are well serviced and comfortable with nice touches. My wife appreciated her surprise birthday cake...!! Tennis and golf good fun. Highly recommended for a relaxing break.
reviews.title: A pleasant surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is a quality property with great staff.
reviews.title: A delightful experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our welcome was friendly and efficient. Breakfast was an extensive buffet catering for the. Variety of nationalities staying here.the waiting staff are mostly older Spanish speaking people. They move at a cracking pace but take some time for pleasantries.
reviews.title: Total relaxation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lounges, library and pool area are all a bit "twee". A bit like sitting in your Great Aunt's chintz house, but it is meant to have the ambience of a Spanish colonial house with an Asian feel. All feels slightly mish mash and not quite pulled together as an interior design theme. But clean, efficient and decor doth not a holiday make.
reviews.title: The caring Hotel Botanico

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our Ambassador suite was similarity chintzy but with all amenities and in perfect working order. Great size, good beds, bath, shower and double balcony. Very nice.
reviews.title: Excellent Easter Weekend

aka: Hotel Botanico And The Oriental Spa Garden
description: Our hotel and spa, located in Puerto de la Cruz in Tenerife, is one of the most prestigious 5 star luxury hotels in the Canary Islands. Being the only official 5 star hotel “Gran Lujo”, we offer an elegant and tranquil atmosphere. In 1998 Hotel Botanico was the first hotel in the Canaries that became a member of the luxury hotel group "The Leading Hotels of The World". Classical in style, there is a timeless grace throughout our hotel, which we carefully maintain through ongoing investment programmes. We offer a variety of luxury accommodation combined with high-class restaurants and leisure facilities, including the award-winning Oriental Spa Garden for total relaxation. Enjoy from your room or suite the extraordinary views of the Atlantic or the Orotava Valley and Mount Teide. Experience the warm culture in this authentic part of Tenerife, combined with one of the most privileged climates in the world. Immerse yourself in the incredible nature, play a round of golf or just relax on the spectacular volcanic beaches.
